alert.note: Alert for Adams; Billings; Bowman; Emmons; Golden Valley; Grant; Hettinger; Logan; McIntosh; Morton; Sioux; Slope; Stark (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued November 02 at 3:45AM CDT until November 02 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS Bismarck
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA THIS AFTERNOON AND EARLY EVENING... .Critical fire weather conditions are expected across much of southwest and south central North Dakota this afternoon and early evening. The area of greatest concern is generally along and south of Interstate 94 and along and west of Highway 83 where afternoon temperatures soaring into the 70s will cause humidity to fall to around 15 percent. Southwest winds are expected to be sustained around 20 to 25 mph this afternoon, with gusts near 35 mph. The prevailing wind direction will be a bit more westerly in the southwest, and a bit more southerly in the south central. A cold front arriving after sunset could prolong gusty winds and shift wind direction to the west-northwest. ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO 8 PM CDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR MUCH OF SOUTHWEST AND SOUTH CENTRAL NORTH DAKOTA... The National Weather Service in Bismarck has issued a Red Flag Warning for wind and low relative humidity, which is in effect from noon today to 8 PM CDT this evening. The Fire Weather Watch is no longer in effect. * WINDS...Southwest 20 to 25 mph with gusts up to 35 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 15 percent. * AFFECTED AREA...Much of southwest and south central North Dakota. * IMPACTS...Any fires that ignite will spread rapidly and become difficult to control or suppress.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are expected to occur. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
